intro: Icica leptostachya, commonly known as the slender-stalked icica, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and sometimes edible roots. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Icica leptostachya is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds.
